title: England to change personnel AND formation against Lithuania following Chris Smalling's injury
text:
Sport England to change personnel AND formation against Lithuania following Chris Smalling's injury Gareth Southgate is expected to go from the three-man defence to a 4-1-4-1 with John Stones partnering Michael Keane Share Stones replaced Smalling in Dortmund and is likely to do so from the start on Sunday (Photo: The FA via Getty) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Chris Smalling has dealt Manchester United another blow after suffering a knee injury while on England duty. 
Red Devils boss Jose Mourinho will be furious after Smalling was sent home on Friday after intensive treatment on a problem that flared up during the midweek loss to Germany. 
The news comes on top of fellow Old Trafford defender Phil Jones suffering a broken big toe in training on Tuesday — in an accidental clash WITH club colleague Smalling . Smalling crocked United team-mate Jones earlier in the week — now he's hurt too (Photo: Getty) 
Mourinho is likely to be unhappy that John Stones and Raheem Sterling of top-four chase rivals Manchester City were rested for the Germany game because of little knocks and the number of games they have played recently. 
Sterling and Stones will both come back into the starting line-up against Lithuania on Sunday, with Gareth Southgate set to revert to a back four at Wembley after using a three-man defence in Dortmund. 
Smalling’s injury and Gary Cahill's suspension means Michael Keane of Burnley will keep his place from midweek, partnering Stones in central defence in what is expected to be a 4-1-4-1 formation. England are also without centre-back, and Wednesday's skipper, Cahill because of a ban (Photo: PA Wire) 
Leicester striker Jamie Vardy is likely to be handed the job of leading the attack after shaking off a knock, with United forward Jesse Lingard also set to start. 
Middlesbrough’s Ben Gibson has been called to the squad to replace Smalling. 
Keeper Joe Hart, who will captain England with Cahill, Wayne Rooney and Jordan Henderson all unavailable, said: “We’re missing a few, but we’ve got a good conveyor belt and some really good options. 
“We’re certainly not having to downgrade in what we do. We just replace and bring someone to the fold and it’s another opportunity for someone to show what they can do at international level.” Like us on Facebook
